result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the DOC's. Remaining balance to be collected during the period of Extended Supervision. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at $0.
Court orders Conditions of Extended Supervision to be developed by the DOC's.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE TO ANY EXISTING SENTENCE); the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS NOT eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 

Court orders conditions of extended supervision to be developed by the Department of Corrections.  
Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.   
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.
defendant from Stanley Correctional, received and filed
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial. Defendant prepared to enter a change of plea.
AS TO COUNT 1:
On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO THE PENALTY ENHANCER AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered the repeater enhancer dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan in court, defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 35.
Atty Flanagan informs the court that he has not spent as much time as he had hoped reviewing this matter and needs to speak with defendant.  Defense will be pursuing the motion to dismiss and motion to suppress that has been previously filed.  Motions to be heard on final pretrial date.  Case set for final pretrial/MOTIONS on 9-8-2016  at 1:30pm  Jury trial set for 9-26-2016 at 9:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward and attorney Thomas Flanagan.  Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court on defense motion to suppress statement.  Defendant recently retained Attorney Flanagan.  Attorney Ward's motion to be withdraw as counsel of record is GRANTED forthwith.  Attorney Ward turns over discovery in court, counsel excused for remainder of hearing.  Court orders defense motion pended at this time.  6/6/16 jury trial date is vacated.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct hearing today.  Matter is adjourned.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Matter remains in contest posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 6/6/16 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Court will not be conducting trials the week of 5/16/16.  Court orders trial date adjourned.  Clerk contacts counsel.  5/16/16 trial date is vacated.  Matter scheduled for jury trial on 6/6/16 at 9:30am.  Matter remains scheduled for motion hearing on 3/17/16 at 1:30pm in Br. 35.

Information

Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in court with attorney Cheryl Anne Ward.  Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Christopher Fritz-MPD Detective.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF5958 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Matthew Fitzgerald Jeffries in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
 Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
